html: Isaiah had previously referred to Christ by the title Immanuel, which means "God is with us" (see Isaiah 7:14; 8:8, 10). The prophet Abinadi, after quoting the entire chapter of Isaiah 53, declared to the priests of King Noah that "God himself shall come down among the children of men, and shall redeem his people" (Mosiah 15:1). All the prophets since the time of Adam had testified of Christ, yet the people would not believe that he was the Messiah spoken of by these prophets (see Rom. 10:16). They would not believe, in spite of the miracles he performed among them, which revealed his power to be "the arm of the Lord" (see John 12:37-38). This phrase is also used to designate the power of the Lord's second coming (see 1 Ne. 22:10-11; D&C 45:47).
